meanings.definition: To groom oneself with the beak or tongue
meanings.sent1: The bird preens its feathers after bathing in the pond.
meanings.sent2: She preens in front of the mirror before going out.
meanings.sent3: The cat preens itself as if preparing for a royal visit.
meanings.sent4: The model preens on the runway, exuding confidence.
meanings.sent5: The peacock preens its colorful plumage, showing off its beauty.

meanings.definition: To pride or congratulate oneself on an achievement
meanings.sent1: He preens after winning the race, feeling proud of his accomplishment.
meanings.sent2: She preens about her successful presentation to the team.
meanings.sent3: The child preens over finishing the puzzle before anyone else.
meanings.sent4: The author preens over the positive reviews of their latest book.
meanings.sent5: The student preens with joy after acing the exam.

meanings.definition: To make oneself appear neat or tidy
meanings.sent1: The cat preens its fur to keep it clean and smooth.
meanings.sent2: He preens his hair before heading to the party.
meanings.sent3: The dog preens itself before meeting its new owner.
meanings.sent4: She preens her outfit, making sure every detail is perfect.
meanings.sent5: The gardener preens the garden, ensuring every flower is in place.
